Description: Basalt kneeling statue of Shedsunefertem, high priest of Memphis and Heliopolis in the reign of Sheshonq I. The figure originally held an object, probably a naos. Stylistic features suggest that it was made for an earlier high priest of Memphis (perhaps Khaemwaset, son of Ramesses II) and reused for Shedsunefertem; head and arms lost; two columns of Hieroglyphic text on the back-pillar; single row around the plinth.
Bibliographic references: Vandier 1965 / Iousaas et (Hathor)- Nebet- Hetepet (pp. 96- 97, pl. 5)
Helck and Otto 1976 / Hoherpriester von Memphis (p. 1261, no. 67)

Maystre 1992 / Les grands prêtres de Ptah de Memphis (p. 338)
Porter and Moss 1999 / Topographical bibliography of ancient Egyptian hieroglyphic texts, reliefs, and paintings: Objects of Provenance not known (pp. 811- 812)
Leahy 2006 / A Battered Statue of Shedsunefertem, High Priest of Memphis
Brandl 2008 / Untersuchungen zur steinernen Privatplastik der Dritten Zwischenzeit: Typologie, Ikonographie, Stilistik (pp. 241-242, pl. 135)
Acquisition name: Donated by: George III, King of the United Kingdom
